channel.title: HP Mini
channel.description:
What are your opinions on this laptop? Specs:
Price: $349.99 Ram: 1G HDD: 160G Processor: Intel Atom Battery: 6-cell lithium-ion Battery life: 8 Hours ~ System bus: 533MHz Built-in Webcam
I am considering this laptop because it's small enough without being to small. Also the specs on it are decent for its price and I really feel like buying it. Remarks?

item.title: HP Mini
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

inertia:

I don’t think the speed at which a computer calculates pi defines it’s real performance.

Mathematical processing… you could do the same thing with calculating hashes.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Mini
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:24, topic:314923”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=411372.msg3035697#msg3035697 date=1258738884]

Most netbooks are the same spec as my chunky laptop now

This. I use an Acer Travelmate for like word processing, IRC, browsing and shit. It’s a 2ghz celeron with 256mb ram or some shit. Netbooks would easily outperform it, and weigh a lot less.
[/quote]That was a pretty dum argument seeing how ur laptop is obviously several years old and netbooks haven’t been around for that long.

“YE A LAPTOP IS BETTER THAN A STATIONARY CUS MY PC ONLY HAS 4MB RAM AND 66MHZ CPU”

You missed the point. My old-ass Travelmate fits my needs perfectly, a netbooks performance would obviously be adequate too.[/quote]A laptop has a decent screen size though, anything under 15" is ridiculously annoying

Read full topic

item.title: HP Mini
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

ps Speljohan_, netbooks fall into the Megahertz/Gigahertz myth (I should say the intel atom)
The Intel atom 1.6Ghz over-clocked by 100Mhz-200Mhz will match or even outperform a 3.06Ghz P4.

I have done some benchmarks by inefficiently calculating PI and my 3.06Ghz p4 just beat my atom @ 1.7Ghz. (approximately by 7%)

Someone else did a different benchmark and the atom outperformed the 3.06Ghz P4.

[b]Asus Eee PC 901 (Intel Atom @ 1.8GHz) 111 seconds My P4 @ 3.06GHz w/915GAG chipset 138 seconds[/b] My other P4 @ 2.4GHz w/SiS651 chipset 155 seconds Asus Eee PC 900 (Intel Celeron M ULV @ 900MHz) 203 seconds

Read full topic

item.title: HP Mini
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote="`Lewk_, post:18, topic:314923"][quote author=Davidude link=topic=411372.msg3034802#msg3034802 date=1258657480]

I expect to have a screen that doesn’t make me cringe and a keyboard that is so compact you misspell shit all the time, hence a laptop is a much better solution. They don’t weigh much thesedays anyway, so there’s no real incentive to get a netbook.

Average good laptop is around 3-4kgs, i find that hurts my shoulders when carrying it in a bag, and the whole point in getting a netbook is that its small… so saying that netbooks screens are too small is redundant. the incentive is that you don’t lug around an extra 3-4kgs and it fits nicely in your bag
[/quote]
Shit nigger dick. My laptop is sooooooo heavy. Boo hoo.

@op
I know netbooks are a decent save of money, but come on. You could get a MUCH better laptop for atleast 100$ more. I mean, A LOT better.[/quote]
Not really, if by better you mean one with a bigger screen and maybe 1 more gig of ram. But it’s not really worth it because I mainly want this netbook for school, and if I ever go on a trip.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Mini
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Davidude:

All was fine until I got in an argument with a certain girl and ended up slamming my bag onto the floor. Of course my netbook was in there and it hasn’t talked to me ever since =[

When you say “it” are referring to Susie or the netbook?

@topic: I have had my netbook (eeepc 904HA) for half a year and its brilliant. Speljohan always moans about performance, but to a sane person it is acceptable. I can run photoshop, netbeans and winamp at the same time comfortably so I personally do not have any problems. Even though you cannot really run games on it- I still run gta 3,vc and sa no problem is low settings. Obviously, start up times of these applications are quite long but once loaded its fine.
I do admit the screen is rather small and 1024x600 res can get annoying. If you have a 10" screen (or a large case) the keyboard size is not a problem.

Read full topic

item.description:

Netbooks are bad because they are incredibly slow, do not have decently sized keyboard and the monitors are ridiculously small.

slow… at what? everything i do on mine is fast. it plays cs1.6 just fine, word runs fast, plays movies just fine.
i thought the same about the keyboards at first, but after a few minutes of using the keyboard i got used to it and its just as comfy as normal keyboards

Read full topic

item.title: HP Mini
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“933pm, post:5, topic:314923”][quote author=`Lewk_ link=topic=411372.msg3034139#msg3034139 date=1258598306]
Don’t buy mini computers.
That’s all I have to say.
[/quote]

this. you will kill yourself in frustration when it takes 5 hours to do the simplest things[/quote]
I don’t see why people have a problem with netbooks, if they really aren’t powerful enough then you really have the wrong idea about them. They are there so you don’t have to feel like you are carrying a load of bricks in your bag with you (like most 15" laptops), and if you really need more power then you need to get a clue and use a desktop computer.

I used to use my netbook for all my college work, was so useful to be able to whip it out on the train, get a few notes in before I had to get off the train. I could even listen to music and watch films on it as well. The battery life was amazing, if I wanted it to last me 13 hours I would obviously leave it on all lowest settings, but even with all the highest settings turned on including wifi, bluetooth and webcam all turned on, it will still get out 4-5 hours battery life.

All was fine until I got in an argument with a certain girl and ended up slamming my bag onto the floor. Of course my netbook was in there and it hasn’t talked to me ever since =[

Read full topic
